question: I had a cut in my toe. I started my isha Salaat there was no blood on it, when I finished my Salaat, I noticed that there was blood on the bandage. So should I repeat my whole Salaat
answer:
QUESTION
1.Once I had a little cut in my toe. When I started my isha namaaz there was no blood on it, but when I finished my namaaz. I noticed that there was blood on the bandage, which means my wudu broke. But I don?t know when the blood came out and got on the bandage. So should I repeat my whole isha namaaz to be on the safe side? 2. If a women?s period start when she?s in fard salaat, then she don?t have to make qadha of it. But if it starts when in Sunnah or Nafl salaat, she has to make qadha of it. SoI don?t remember in wh my question is my periods started when I was doing my isha salat. But at rakaat it started. If it was fard, sunnat or nafl. So what should I do, again should repeat whole isha salaat? All 17 rakaats?
ANSWER


Share:
1. Yes, you should repeat your Salaat to be on the safe side.
2. As a matter of precaution, you should repeat all your Sunnats and
Nawaafil Salaats.

and Allah Ta'ala Knows Best

Mufti Ebrahim Desai
